trans-unit.source: Database-wide properties, which affect a single database, are stored within the database itself. This allows different databases within a single <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system to have different properties and ensures that the properties are correctly retained when a database is moved away from its original system or copied.

seg-source.mrk: Database-wide properties, which affect a single database, are stored within the database itself.

This allows different databases within a single <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system to have different properties and ensures that the properties are correctly retained when a database is moved away from its original system or copied.

target.mrk: Database-wide properties, which affect a single database, are stored within the database itself.

This allows different databases within a single <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system to have different properties and ensures that the properties are correctly retained when a database is moved away from its original system or copied.

trans-unit.source: You should use database-wide properties wherever possible for ease of deployment and for security.

seg-source.mrk: You should use database-wide properties wherever possible for ease of deployment and for security.

target.mrk: You should use database-wide properties wherever possible for ease of deployment and for security.

trans-unit.source: You set and verify database-wide properties using system procedures within SQL statements.

seg-source.mrk: You set and verify database-wide properties using system procedures within SQL statements.

target.mrk: You set and verify database-wide properties using system procedures within SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: To set a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> procedure, passing the name of the property and the value.

seg-source.mrk: To set a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> procedure, passing the name of the property and the value.

target.mrk: To set a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> procedure, passing the name of the property and the value.

trans-unit.source: To check the current value of a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, passing in the name of the property.

seg-source.mrk: To check the current value of a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, passing in the name of the property.

target.mrk: To check the current value of a property, you connect to the database, create a statement, and then use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, passing in the name of the property.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an invalid value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value for the property. (If you call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, however, it displays the invalid value.)

seg-source.mrk: If you specify an invalid value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value for the property.
(If you call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, however, it displays the invalid value.)

target.mrk: If you specify an invalid value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> uses the default value for the property.
(If you call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY</codeph> function, however, it displays the invalid value.)

trans-unit.source: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information on how to use these system functions and procedures.

seg-source.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information on how to use these system functions and procedures.

target.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph> for more information on how to use these system functions and procedures.
